it.polimi.se2018.model

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2018.utils.Observable
      • it.polimi.se2018.model.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Observer

    public class Game
extends Observable
implements Observer
    Main class of the Model. An instance of this class represent a specific real game going on on the server. This class implements the OBSERVER PATTERN in order to notify all the Views connected.
    Author:
    Federico Haag, Lorenzo Minto, Jacopo Pio Gargano

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(int numberOfRounds,
            int maxNumberOfPlayers)
        Constructor for a new Game instance. Basic configuration is passed as argument. Cards will be assigned later.
        Parameters:
        numberOfRounds - the number of rounds the game is composed of
        maxNumberOfPlayers - the maximum number of players that the game can have

      • assignWindowPatternToPlayer

        public boolean assignWindowPatternToPlayer(WindowPattern windowPattern,
                                           java.lang.String playerID)
        Try to assign the given window pattern to the given player
        Parameters:
        windowPattern - the window pattern to assign to the player
        playerID - the player id of the player that choose the given windowPattern
        Returns:
        true if windowPattern was succesfully assigned to the given player. false if not.

      • getToolCard

        public ToolCard getToolCard(ToolCard toolCardCopy)
        Gets the toolCard in the model that corresponds to the passed shallow copy.
        Parameters:
        toolCardCopy - the toolCard shallow copy.
        Returns:
        the actual toolCard from the drawnToolCards, or null if no such card is found.

      • setStatusAsWaitingForPatternsChoice

        public void setStatusAsWaitingForPatternsChoice()
        Sets the game status to waiting for patterns choice

      • forceEndGameDueToInactivity

        public void forceEndGameDueToInactivity()
        Sets the game status to ended. It is called by controller when active players are less than minimum number of players

      • startGame

        public void startGame(java.util.List<Dice> dices,
                      java.util.Set<Move> permissions)
        Starts the game and creates the first round with the given dices
        Parameters:
        dices - list of dices to be used for the first round
        permissions - the set of permissions at the beginning of the game

      • nextRound

        public void nextRound(java.util.List<Dice> dices,
                      java.util.Set<Move> permissions)
               throws NoMoreRoundsAvailableException
        Proceed the game going to the next round (if available).
        Parameters:
        dices - the dices that are drafted from the dicebag for the new round
        permissions - the set of permissions for the next round
        Throws:
        NoMoreRoundsAvailableException - if the method is called but all the rounds that could have been played in this game were actually already played

      • nextTurn

        public void nextTurn(java.util.Set<Move> permissions)
              throws NoMoreTurnsAvailableException
        Advances the game to the following turn Notifies the observers (View) with the list of the players that will play the following turns
        Parameters:
        permissions - the set of permissions for the next turn
        Throws:
        NoMoreTurnsAvailableException - if no more turns are available in this round

      • update

        public boolean update(Message m)
        Description copied from interface: Observer
        This method is called whenever the observed object is changed. An application calls an Observable object's Observable.notify(Message) method to have all the object's observers notified of the change.
        Specified by:
        update in interface Observer
        Parameters:
        m - an argument passed to the Observable.notify(Message) method
        Returns:
        true if message is successfully sent
